Sub: Dealing with cases of Hoax Calls at airports : Rea-

In the last few months, there has been an increase in the number of Hoax calls
about bomb threat at the airports. Approximately, 44 such calls were reported in the year
2015 and this year 36 such hoax calls have already been received.

2 These hoax calls cause tremendous inconvenience to passengers; disruption of
flight operations and services at the airports. The disturbance in the flight schedule leads
to delays and many a times passengers miss their connecting flights and lose their
baggage in the chaos caused by flight delays.

a It is vital to curb such hoax calls with the co-operation/co-ordination amongst
various agencies working at the airport. Registration of cases under the ‘The
suppression of Unlawful acts against safety of Civil Aviation Act, 1982” (copy
enclosed) will act as strong deterrent to such callers. The extracts of relevant sections
under this act are as under:

-  *3A. offence at airport —

(1) Whoever, at any airport unlawfully and intentionally, using any device,
substance or weapon -

(b) destroys or seriously damages any aircraft or facility at an airport or
disrupts any service at the airport, endangering or threatening to
endanger safety at that airport,

shall be punished with imprisonment for life and shall also be liable to
fine.

4. Being prime security agency at the airport, all CASOs are directed to advise
concerned Airlines/Airport Operators to file criminal complaints under this act with the
local police in addition to other laws/sections of IPC and pursue this issue with State
Police.

5. Zonal DisG are also directed to closely monitor all such hoax calls at the airports
under their respective jurisdiction for implementation of above directions meticulously.

6. Please acknowledge receipt and ensure strict compliance.
Encl : As above

5. Jurisdiction — (1) Subject to the
Provisions of sub-section (2), where an offence
under section 3 is committed outside India, the
Person committing such offence may be dealt
with in respect thereof as if such offence had
been committed at any place within India at
which he may be found.

(2) No court shall take cognizance of an
offence punishable under section 3 which is
committed outside India unless —

(a) such offence is committed on board an
aircraft registered in India;

(b) such offence is committed on board an
aircraft which is for the time being leased
without crew to a lessee who has his
principal place of business, or where he
has no such place of business, his
permanent residence in India; or

(©) the alleged offender is a citizen of India
or is on board the aircraft in relation to
which such offence is committed when
itlands in India or is found in India.
